items.def: Cited in Matt 2:1-6 and consistent with Luke 2 census setting relevant because it ties a specific place prophecy to widely known nativity tradition
Interpreted in Mark 10:45 Mark 15 and 1 Pet 2:22-25 relevant because a shame filled death is re read as purposeful atonement rooted in prior Scripture
Mocking and casting lots echoed in John 19 and Mark 15 relevant because incidental overlaps arise from standard Roman execution practices
Applied in Matt 21 and John 12 relevant because it shows Jesus enacting a royal sign that claims messianic identity in a public way
Reflected in Matt 26:15 and Matt 27:3-10 relevant because the amount and temple use are framed to connect the betrayal to prophetic imagery
